terms.definition: A situation where someone claims to own something, but their claim is not legally recognized or supported.
The person or entity who legally holds title and has the recognized right to possess, use, and dispose of an item or property.
Holding or using something without the legal right, permission, or authority of the true owner.
Declarations by an individual or entity stating they have a legal right to possess or control a specific item or property.
Government bodies, officials, or organizations that have the legal power and jurisdiction to make decisions or take action on a particular matter.
A phrase used in legal documents to assign a shorter, consistent name or term to a party or item for the remainder of the text.
Statements or demands for something that are not legally sound, recognized, or enforceable.
A legal document that officially transfers property ownership and has been recorded with a government office to provide public notice.
A legal document that officially transfers ownership of a property from the seller to the buyer upon completion of a sale.
A legal phrase referring to a specific piece of property that has already been mentioned or identified within the document.
A term used in a document to refer to the person or people who have signed it.
A legal paper showing that property or rights are being moved from one person or entity to another.
A legal transaction where ownership of something is properly moved from one party to another, meeting all legal requirements and procedures.
